intro: Thesium macrogyne, commonly known as the large-fruited thesium, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae and is characterized by its upright, herbaceous growth habit. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in dense clusters, which are typically visited by various pollinators. Its leaves are linear and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Thesium macrogyne is adapted to grow in well-drained soils and is often found in grassland or rocky habitats.
